actor_awards.notes: Lamas was nominated for a Tony Award for Best Actor in a Musical for 'Happy Hunting' (1957). He received a Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame for Television in 1960.

filmography.title: The Merry Widow
filmography.role_description: A charming, womanizing count who is ordered by his King to woo a wealthy widow to save their small nation from bankruptcy.
filmography.plot: A rich widow visits the small kingdom of Marshovia, where the desperate King sends his most dashing count to seduce her and keep her money in the country.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Art Direction, Best Costume Design

filmography.title: Dangerous When Wet
filmography.role_description: A wealthy French champagne salesman who courts Esther Williams while she trains to swim the English Channel.
filmography.plot: A dairy farmer's daughter travels to England to swim the English Channel and falls in love with a suave Frenchman.

filmography.title: 100 Rifles
filmography.role_description: A ruthless Mexican general suppressing a Yaqui Indian rebellion who hunts the protagonists across the desert.
filmography.plot: An American lawman, a bank robber, and a female revolutionary team up to fight a tyrannical general in 1912 Mexico.

filmography.title: Sangaree
filmography.role_description: The son of an indentured servant who rises to manage a Georgia estate, fighting pirates and the bubonic plague.
filmography.plot: In post-Revolutionary Georgia, a doctor inherits the management of a wealthy estate, sparking a feud with the owner's daughter.
filmography.awards: None (Notable for being a 3-D Technicolor release)

filmography.title: The Lost World
filmography.role_description: A guitar-playing helicopter pilot who joins Professor Challenger's expedition to a prehistoric plateau.
filmography.plot: A professor leads an expedition to a remote plateau in the Amazon where dinosaurs still roam.

filmography.title: The Girl Who Had Everything
filmography.role_description: A suave, dangerous gangster and gambler who becomes the object of affection for the defense attorney's daughter.
filmography.plot: The daughter of a successful defense attorney falls for one of his clients, a charming but ruthless racketeer.

filmography.title: Rose Marie
filmography.role_description: A rugged French-Canadian trapper and outlaw who competes with a Mountie for the love of a wild backwoods girl.
filmography.plot: A Mountie and a trapper vie for the affections of a girl they find living in the Canadian wilderness.

filmography.title: Rich, Young and Pretty
filmography.role_description: A handsome Parisian who becomes the romantic interest of a young Texan woman visiting France.
filmography.plot: A wealthy Texan takes his daughter to Paris, where she meets her mother and falls in love with a dashing Frenchman.

filmography.title: The Diamond Queen
filmography.role_description: A famous 17th-century French traveler and gem merchant who journeys to India to find a diamond for the King's crown.
filmography.plot: An adventurer travels to India to replace a diamond he accidentally destroyed, engaging in battles and romance with a Queen.

filmography.title: Jivaro
filmography.role_description: A tough trading post owner in the Amazon jungle who tries to protect a woman searching for her fiancé from headhunters.
filmography.plot: A woman arrives at a remote Brazilian trading post to find her fiancé, who has ventured into dangerous Jivaro territory for gold.

filmography.title: The Law and the Lady
filmography.role_description: A debonair suitor who woos a female con artist posing as a lady in high society San Francisco.
filmography.plot: Two distinguished con artists infiltrate San Francisco society to steal a necklace, but romance complicates their plans.

filmography.title: The Violent Ones
filmography.role_description: A Mexican-American sheriff who must protect three despised suspects from a lynch mob after a brutal crime.
filmography.plot: A sheriff tries to keep three men safe from a vengeful town after a local girl is assaulted, while trying to determine which one is guilty.

filmography.title: Kill a Dragon
filmography.role_description: A powerful and cruel warlord who controls an island near Hong Kong, serving as the antagonist to Jack Palance's hero.
filmography.plot: A soldier of fortune is hired to protect a Chinese village's salvage claim on a load of nitroglycerin from a ruthless pirate.

filmography.title: The Cheap Detective
filmography.role_description: A parody of Paul Henreid's Victor Laszlo from 'Casablanca', playing the noble resistance leader husband.
filmography.plot: A bumbling private eye tries to solve his partner's murder while navigating a sea of dames, spies, and cops in this Humphrey Bogart spoof.

filmography.title: The Avengers
filmography.role_description: A French swordsman and adventurer in colonial South America who aids the hero in his fight against a tyrant.
filmography.plot: In colonial Argentina, a man seeks revenge for his father's murder and fights to depose a corrupt governor.

filmography.title: The Girl Rush
filmography.role_description: A Las Vegas hotel owner who romances a woman trying to claim her inheritance.
filmography.plot: A woman heads to Las Vegas to visit the hotel her father left her half of, only to find it's a gambling joint.

filmography.title: Duel of Fire
filmography.role_description: A man who infiltrates a bandit gang to seek revenge for the attack on his sister.
filmography.plot: A man joins a group of outlaws to identify and kill the men who assaulted his sister.

filmography.title: Revenge of the Musketeers
filmography.role_description: The legendary musketeer who leads his comrades on a mission to save the French crown from Cardinal Mazarin's schemes.
filmography.plot: D'Artagnan and the Three Musketeers reunite to rescue the King of England and thwart a plot by Cardinal Mazarin.

filmography.title: The Magic Fountain
filmography.role_description: Lamas directed and starred in this fantasy film alongside his wife Esther Williams.
filmography.plot: A fantasy adventure involving a magical fountain, shot in Spain.

filmography.title: A Place Called Glory
filmography.role_description: While primarily a writer/producer on this project, it is a notable spaghetti western credit in his filmography.
filmography.plot: Two gunfighters are hired to kill each other but team up to take over the town instead.

filmography.title: Vidalita
filmography.role_description: An army captain who falls in love with a 'gaucho' who is actually a woman in disguise.
filmography.plot: A young woman disguises herself as a gaucho to protect her grandfather's land and falls for a captain.

filmography.title: La rubia Mireya
filmography.role_description: A leading role in this classic Argentine drama about a woman abandoned by her husband.
filmography.plot: A woman struggles to rebuild her life and reclaim her daughter after a difficult divorce.

filmography.title: Historia de una mala mujer
filmography.role_description: A key supporting role in this Argentine adaptation of Oscar Wilde's 'Lady Windermere's Fan'.
filmography.plot: A woman with a scandalous past tries to save her daughter from making the same mistakes.

filmography.title: Murder on Flight 502
filmography.role_description: A mysterious passenger on a threatened airliner who may hold clues to the bomber's identity.
filmography.plot: A commercial flight is threatened by a maniac who plants a bomb on board, leading to a tense search for the culprit among the passengers.

filmography.title: The Lonely Profession
filmography.role_description: A wealthy and powerful man involved in a private investigator's murder case.
filmography.plot: A private eye becomes the prime suspect in a murder case he was hired to investigate.

filmography.title: Won Ton Ton: The Dog Who Saved Hollywood
filmography.role_description: A cameo appearance as a glamorous movie star attending a Hollywood premiere.
filmography.plot: A dog becomes a major movie star in 1920s Hollywood, but his fame causes chaos for his owners.
